page.title: 20CHEDDAR CAVES
page.content: There have been{caves}in Cheddar for thousands of years but not like the ones the tourists visit. Originally they were home for cavemen and animals. People were still living in them at the turn of the twentieth century.{Visitors}have been coming to Cheddar for decades to see the cliffs and original caves. There were always poor people living in them and in cottages in the gorge who were only too pleased to make a few pennies by showing them around using candlelight Then in 1837 the first of the show caves was discovered by a man called George Cox.}He sent a workman across the hillside to fetch some rocks and after a period of time his workman failed to return. George found him in a gaping hole in the ground from which led the chambers of the {Cox's cave system.
